intro: Veronica ocymifolia, commonly known as the slender speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features opposite, linear to lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, blue or violet flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Veronica ocymifolia is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and easy maintenance.
